greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of sine of 36 degrees.
comment: This sequence is also decimal expansion of cosine of 54 degrees. - _Mohammad K. Azarian_, Jun 29 2013
The ratio of side to longer diagonal for any golden rhombus (see A019881). - _Rick L. Shepherd_, Apr 10 2017
link: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..999
formula: sin 36 degrees = sin Pi/5 radians = sqrt((1/8)(5 - sqrt(5))).
xref: Cf. A019827 (sine of 18 degrees), A019881 (sine of 72 degrees), A001622 (golden ratio phi). A182007.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
